results.title: Lichtspiel: Opus I
results.brief_description: Against a dark background, several bright, curved or rounded shapes pulse towards the center of the screen, one at a time. They are followed by many other shapes, some irregular, some pointed, others rounded. The abstract shapes move into or across the screen in harmony with the musical score.

constellations_other.name: Colour and illusion
constellations_other.description: Exploring the science of colour, light, reflection and movement.

results.description: Against a dark background, several bright, curved or rounded shapes pulse towards the center of the screen, one at a time. They are followed by many other shapes, some irregular, some pointed, others rounded. The abstract shapes move into or across the screen in harmony with the musical score.

They are followed by many other shapes, some irregular, some pointed, others rounded. The abstract shapes move into or across the screen in harmony with the musical score.

results.title: Letter to Jane: An Investigation About a Still
results.brief_description: The film’s subject is a photograph of Jane Fonda visiting Hanoi during the Vietnam War. It asks what the position of the intellectual should be in the class struggle and points out the irony of Jane Fonda’s participation in the photo shoot, which was staged.

constellations_other.name: Film-truth
constellations_other.description: The experimental documentary Man with a Movie Camera has had a lasting impact on the development of film styles.

results.title_for_label: Letter to Jane: An Investigation About a Still
results.description: The film’s subject is a photograph of Jane Fonda visiting Hanoi during the Vietnam War. It asks what the position of the intellectual should be in the class struggle and points out the irony of Jane Fonda’s participation in the photo shoot, which was staged.

results.title: Let It Be
results.creator_credit: Neil Aspinall, Michael Lindsay-Hogg and Apple Corps
results.brief_description: Documentary film about The Beatles rehearsing and recording songs for the album Let It Be in January 1969. The film features an unannounced rooftop concert by the group, their last performance in public. Released just after the album, it was the final original Beatles release. This film has not been commercially available since the 1980s.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Neil Aspinall, Michael Lindsay-Hogg and Apple Corps
results.description: Documentary film about The Beatles rehearsing and recording songs for the album Let It Be in January 1969. The film features an unannounced rooftop concert by the group, their last performance in public. Released just after the album, it was the final original Beatles release. This film has not been commercially available since the 1980s.

results.title: Les Liaisons Dangereuses
results.brief_description: Juliette Merteuil and Valmont is a sophisticated couple, always looking for fun and excitement. Both have sexual affairs with others and share their experiences with one another. But there is one rule: never fall in love. But this time Valmont falls madly in love with a girl he meets at a ski resort, Marianne.

constellations_other.name: Power and privilege, monarchy and make-up
constellations_other.description: The upper echelons of society explored through colour, make-up and scandal.

results.description: Juliette Merteuil and Valmont is a sophisticated couple, always looking for fun and excitement. Both have sexual affairs with others and share their experiences with one another. But there is one rule: never fall in love. But this time Valmont falls madly in love with a girl he meets at a ski resort, Marianne.

results.title: Léon: The Professional
results.headline_credit: France and United States of America, 1994
results.brief_description: Léon, the top hit man in New York, has earned a rep as an effective “cleaner”. But when his next-door neighbors are wiped out by a loose-cannon DEA agent, he becomes the unwilling custodian of 12-year-old Mathilda.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

results.description: Léon, the top hit man in New York, has earned a rep as an effective “cleaner”. But when his next-door neighbors are wiped out by a loose-cannon DEA agent, he becomes the unwilling custodian of 12-year-old Mathilda. Before long, Mathilda’s thoughts turn to revenge, and she considers following in Léon’s footsteps.
description_for_label: Léon, the top hit man in New York, has earned a rep as an effective “cleaner”. But when his next-door neighbors are wiped out by a loose-cannon DEA agent, he becomes the unwilling custodian of 12-year-old Mathilda. Before long, Mathilda’s thoughts turn to revenge, and she considers following in Léon’s footsteps.

results.title: Lemonade
results.brief_description: The second “visual album” (a collection of short films) by Beyoncé, this time around she takes a piercing look at racial issues and feminist concepts through a sexualized, satirical, and solemn tone.

constellations_other.name: Cleverman
constellations_other.description: Cleverman is dystopian sci-fi with a difference. With a predominantly Indigenous cast and senior crew, the series explores Aboriginal origin stories in a contemporary context, while examining themes of class, racism and power.

results.description: The second “visual album” (a collection of short films) by Beyoncé, this time around she takes a piercing look at racial issues and feminist concepts through a sexualized, satirical, and solemn tone.
description_for_label: The second “visual album” (a collection of short films) by Beyoncé, this time around she takes a piercing look at racial issues and feminist concepts through a sexualized, satirical, and solemn tone.

results.title: Legion
results.brief_description: David Haller, AKA Legion, is a troubled young man who may be more than human.

constellations_other.name: VFX to fantasy and freedom
constellations_other.description: Founded in Sydney, and now with offices worldwide, Animal Logic are an Academy Award-winning VFX and animation studio whose job is to bring the impossible to life. And they're in good company with these other artists and filmmakers.

results.description: David Haller, AKA Legion, is a troubled young man who may be more than human. Diagnosed as schizophrenic, David has been in and out of psychiatric hospitals for years. But after a strange encounter with a fellow patient, he’s confronted with the possibility that the voices he hears and the visions he sees might be real.
description_for_label: David Haller, AKA Legion, is a troubled young man who may be more than human. Diagnosed as schizophrenic, David has been in and out of psychiatric hospitals for years. But after a strange encounter with a fellow patient, he’s confronted with the possibility that the voices he hears and the visions he sees might be real.

results.title: Lawless
results.creator_credit: Chris Kennedy, John Hillcoat, Nick Cave, Lucy Fisher, Megan Ellison, Doug Wick, Margot Wilson, Blum Hanson Allen Films, Revolt Films, Red Wagon Entertainment, Pie Films Inc., Annapurna Pictures, Yucaipa Films, Benaroya Pictures and The Weinstein Company
results.brief_description: Set in the Depression-era Franklin County, Virginia, a bootlegging gang is threatened by authorities who want a cut of their profits.

constellations_other.name: Outlaws and the end
constellations_other.description: Tracing connections from Sweet Country to Australian westerns and resistance to white colonial narratives.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Kennedy, John Hillcoat, Nick Cave, Lucy Fisher, Megan Ellison, Doug Wick, Margot Wilson, Blum Hanson Allen Films, Revolt Films, Red Wagon Entertainment, Pie Films Inc., Annapurna Pictures, Yucaipa Films, Benaroya Pictures and The Weinstein Company

results.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
results.brief_description: In the criminal justice system, sexually-based offenses are considered especially heinous. In New York City, the dedicated detectives who investigate these vicious felonies are members of an elite squad known as the Special Victims Unit. These are their stories.

constellations_other.name: Fight for your right
constellations_other.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

results.description: In the criminal justice system, sexually-based offenses are considered especially heinous. In New York City, the dedicated detectives who investigate these vicious felonies are members of an elite squad known as the Special Victims Unit. These are their stories.

results.title: Lassie
results.brief_description:
Lassie is an American television series that follows the adventures of a female Rough Collie dog named Lassie and her companions, human and animal. The show was the creation of producer Robert Maxwell and animal trainer Rudd Weatherwax and was televised from September 12, 1954, to March 24, 1973. One of the longest-running series on television, the show chalked up seventeen seasons on CBS before entering first-run syndication for its final two seasons. Initially filmed in black and white, the show transitioned to color in 1965.

The show’s first ten seasons follow Lassie’s adventures in a small farming community. Fictional eleven-year-old Jeff Miller, his mother, and his grandfather are Lassie’s first human companions until seven-year-old Timmy Martin and his adoptive parents take over in the fourth season. When Lassie’s exploits on the farm end in the eleventh season, she finds new adventures in the wilderness with a succession of United States Forest Service Rangers. After traveling without human leads for a year, Lassie finally settles at a children’s home for her final two syndicated seasons.

Lassie received critical favor at its debut and won two Emmy Awards in its first years. Stars Jan Clayton and June Lockhart were nominated for Emmys. Merchandise produced during the show’s run included books, a Halloween costume, clothing, toys, and other items. Campbell’s Soup, the show’s lifelong sponsor, offered two premiums, and distributed thousands to fans. A multi-part episode was edited into the feature film Lassie’s Great Adventure and released in August 1963. In 1989, the television series The New Lassie brought Lassie star Jon Provost back to television as Steve McCullough. Selected episodes have been released to DVD.
